website_summaries.verdict: A slightly older elementary resource that branches out into more diverse map styles and discusses how geography and culture intersect.
pros: Engaging book that spends some time connecting culture and geography
Students answer questions based on text and illustrations
cons: Answer key occasionally includes information not covered in text

customer_reviews.title: Homeschool Moms, these are A+++
customer_reviews.text: I think we have every 180 days subject offered- as a new homeschool mom these workbooks are great supplement work for the kids and on days off, instead of doing nothing, they can work a page in these books - self guided.
customer_reviews.author: Madra

customer_reviews.title: Would HIGHLY recommend!
customer_reviews.text: My 10 year old loves the layout of these books and I do too. We use the 180 Days of Science and Social Studies workbooks as well. I'm so pleased with this purchase! These workbooks are always one of the first suggestions when other homeschoolers ask about workbooks and/or daily work. 10/10
customer_reviews.author: Desiré

customer_reviews.title: Great for distance learning
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this to use during virtual learning with my 4th grader. Love the material! Very informative and easy to understand for the kiddo. Lots of activities. With virtual learning being a hot mess, kiddo gets extremely bored during zoom meetings. So, we’ve got back-up with some books to continue his learning.
customer_reviews.author: Heidi Black

customer_reviews.title: Good little tool.
customer_reviews.text: Good filler or conversation stater. If your having a hard time finding a topic to work on these are a good start. They are simple straight to the point quick topics or long depending on how you do your stuff. The only downfall we found is that sometimes the answer key expects answers that are not necessarily covered in the reading. However this is not totally a bad thing if you are encouraging kiddos to think for themselves.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great summer learning resource
customer_reviews.text: This book has been a great tool to use during the summer to keep the wheels of learning turning for our soon to be 5th grader. The material is just enough (we complete one week each day M-F and take the weekends off). We usually complete each week in well under 15 minutes. I usually supplement each week with some sort of relevant YT video, and our kiddo has really enjoyed it. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Lisa M.

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic!
customer_reviews.text: This book was better than expected. I didn’t realize it came with maps and a progress chart to see where your child is excelling and needs extra work. As a homeschool mom I highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: brandy Trower

customer_reviews.title: Works very good as workbook!  Works best as a review workbook.
customer_reviews.text: Very short work sheets which work well for my daughter. With all the work she completed in a day, these are short and sweet and not overwhelming. However, I use this book more like a review since the stories are very short. I usually teach my daughter the subject with other books, worksheets, and this is an extra quick review.
customer_reviews.author: ERome

customer_reviews.title: Great For Homeschool
customer_reviews.text: I homeschool and this is awesome and easy as well as helpful. The 180 days give me a great day to day curriculum to follow and the cd. My daughter loves these books.
customer_reviews.author: K sim

customer_reviews.title: Not for a standalone.  Need a parent or teacher guide...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this ti supplement our childs education. This workbook is not a standalone book. You need to also have a parent/teacher guide to go along with this as many things are not taught. Just worksheets.. Save your money, these 180 days are not helpful, although they are simple for kiddos to follow along.
customer_reviews.author: SoMote

customer_reviews.title: Nice set up, but incorrect answer keys
customer_reviews.text: I love that these books are easy to use and self-guided, but it needs work. We are only 2 weeks into it and there have been several wrong answers in the answer key. These work, but aren’t accurate.
customer_reviews.author: THughes

customer_reviews.title: Simple 4th grade workbook
customer_reviews.text: Theres not a ton of workbooks for geography, so this one is pretty nice to find. We are using it during the Corona lockdown to supplement the kids schooling. The lessons are very short, one page each. So there isnt much depth to them, but it does introduce and cover some good topics
customer_reviews.author: Gary Braham

customer_reviews.title: Great Guideline
customer_reviews.text: Love it so far. I love that the pages are perforated so im putting them into sheet protectors and into a 3 ring binder. I have one going into 1st grade as well. If i continue to homeschool I'd like to reuse them.
customer_reviews.author: krobertson

customer_reviews.title: No color - unattractive
customer_reviews.text: I returned it because they show a picture of a colored notebook on the Amazon page, but inside, it's only black and white. Unattractive to keep my kid interested in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Franck

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Just what I needed. Just enough and comes with an answer key
customer_reviews.author: Brittany

customer_reviews.title: Good production
customer_reviews.text: Great book my 3rd grader was able to get thru it. I would recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: JENNIFER

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Great resource, really enjoy how it’s laid out and the different activities!
customer_reviews.author: Shannon Peter

customer_reviews.title: Engagement
customer_reviews.text: I love the information in these resources because it keeps my Students engaged in learning.
customer_reviews.author: t

customer_reviews.title: We just started using it.
customer_reviews.text: We are using this as an add on to our other geography curriculum.
customer_reviews.author: April Marshall

customer_reviews.title: Book is very teacher friendly.
customer_reviews.text: Book is perfect for homeschooling. Very way to use and understand.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: 180 Days of Social Studies: Grade 4 - Daily Geography Workbook for Classroom and Home, Cool and Fun Practice, Elementary School Level Activities ... to Build Skills (180 Days of Practice)
